context_of_use: The use case occurs when an IFA administrator reviews newly registered leagues and teams in the system for integrity and compliance before allowing them to become active in the IFA environment.
stakeholders_and_interests: ifa administrator: Wants to approve only legitimate and compliant leagues and teams so that system integrity is maintained.
IFA: Wants registrations to be controlled so that only valid leagues and teams operate within the system, preserving fairness and integrity.
Leagues: Want their registration to be processed efficiently so that they can start using the system.
Teams: Want their registration to be processed efficiently so that they can participate in competitions managed by the system.
description: This use case describes how the ifa administrator reviews and approves newly registered leagues and teams in the IFA Management System to ensure that only valid and authorized entities are activated in the system.
triggering_event: The ifa administrator decides to review and approve newly registered leagues and teams in the system.
preconditions: The IFA Management System is operational and accessible to the ifa administrator.
The ifa administrator is authenticated and authorized to review and approve registrations.
At least one new league or team registration exists in a pending state within the system.
postconditions: All selected pending league registrations have been updated to an approved or explicitly left pending state in the system.
All selected pending team registrations have been updated to an approved or explicitly left pending state in the system.
The system maintains an auditable record of the approval decisions made by the ifa administrator for the processed registrations.
assumptions: It is assumed that all new leagues and teams are initially stored in the system with a status indicating that approval is required before activation.

It is assumed that the ifa administrator has the combined responsibilities described in the requirements for approving both new leagues and new teams even though the original text refers to an "IFA manager".

It is assumed that the system provides the ifa administrator with a list or view of pending registrations filtered by status, without adding any new search or filtering capabilities beyond what is necessary to see pending items.

It is assumed that approval of a league or team in this use case does not automatically perform any additional actions beyond marking the entity as approved and available for subsequent use by other existing system functions.

It is assumed that the system records the identity of the ifa administrator and a timestamp associated with each approval decision in order to support integrity and traceability, consistent with maintaining integrity but without introducing any new functional process.
requirements_met: The system shall allow the ifa administrator to view all newly registered teams that are awaiting approval.
The system shall allow the ifa administrator to view all newly added leagues that are awaiting approval.
The system shall allow the ifa administrator to approve newly registered teams so that only approved teams become active in the system.
The system shall allow the ifa administrator to approve newly added leagues so that only approved leagues become active in the system.
The system shall update the status of a team from pending to approved when the ifa administrator approves the team.
The system shall update the status of a league from pending to approved when the ifa administrator approves the league.
The system shall record the ifa administrator identifier and approval timestamp for each approved team registration to support integrity.
The system shall record the ifa administrator identifier and approval timestamp for each approved league registration to support integrity.
outstanding_issues: Criteria for determining whether a league registration should be approved (e.g., documentation, eligibility rules) are not specified.
Criteria for determining whether a team registration should be approved (e.g., affiliation, compliance with league rules) are not specified.
It is not defined whether the ifa administrator may reject or only defer registrations not approved; the handling of explicit rejection is unclear.
It is not specified whether notifications are sent to leagues or teams upon approval of their registration.
It is unclear whether batch approval of multiple registrations in a single operation is required or whether approvals must be performed individually.
main_flow: 1. ifa administrator selects the option to review pending registrations → System displays an overview of all pending league and team registrations.
2. ifa administrator selects a pending league registration to review → System displays the detailed information for the selected league registration.

3. ifa administrator reviews the displayed league registration information and decides to approve it → System records the approval decision, updates the league status to approved, and logs the administrator identity and timestamp.
4. ifa administrator returns to the overview of pending registrations → System updates and displays the overview reflecting the changed status of the processed league registration.
5. ifa administrator selects a pending team registration to review → System displays the detailed information for the selected team registration.

6. ifa administrator reviews the displayed team registration information and decides to approve it → System records the approval decision, updates the team status to approved, and logs the administrator identity and timestamp.

7. ifa administrator returns to the overview of pending registrations → System displays the updated overview, indicating the remaining pending registrations, and confirms completion of the approvals performed in this session.
alternative_flows: AF-1 (from Step 2): If the ifa administrator chooses to skip approval of the selected league registration after viewing its details, the administrator closes the league details view → System returns to the overview of pending registrations without modifying the status of the league, and processing continues with Step 4.

AF-2 (from Step 5): If the ifa administrator chooses to skip approval of the selected team registration after viewing its details, the administrator closes the team details view → System returns to the overview of pending registrations without modifying the status of the team, and processing continues with Step 7.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 1): If the system cannot retrieve pending registrations due to a system error, the system displays an error message indicating that pending registrations are temporarily unavailable and provides no registration list → The use case terminates without any approval actions being performed.

EF-2 (from Step 3): If the system fails to update the league status to approved due to a persistence or validation error, the system displays an error message indicating that the approval could not be completed and leaves the league registration in its prior pending state → The system returns to the league registration details view and the use case continues only if the ifa administrator chooses another action supported by the system.

EF-3 (from Step 6): If the system fails to update the team status to approved due to a persistence or validation error, the system displays an error message indicating that the approval could not be completed and leaves the team registration in its prior pending state → The system returns to the team registration details view and the use case continues only if the ifa administrator chooses another action supported by the system.
information_for_steps: 1. Pending registration list including registration identifiers, entity type (league or team), status, and summary attributes.
2. Selected league registration details including league identifier, league name, associated competition information, and registration metadata.
3. League approval decision, updated league status, administrator identifier, and approval timestamp.
4. Refreshed pending registration list reflecting updated status of the processed league registration.
5. Selected team registration details including team identifier, team name, associated league information, and registration metadata.
6. Team approval decision, updated team status, administrator identifier, and approval timestamp.
7. Updated pending registration overview, count of remaining pending registrations, and confirmation of completed approvals in the current session.
